Plex Media Server

← Back to Documentation

Overview

Plex is a client-server media player system that allows you to stream your personal media collection from anywhere. Our Plex server hosts a large collection of movies, TV shows, and other media content, accessible to authorized users.

Features

  • High-Quality Streaming: Automatic transcoding ensures optimal playback on any device
  • Cross-Platform: Available on web browsers, mobile apps, smart TVs, and streaming devices
  • User Management: Individual user accounts with personalized watch history and recommendations
  • Offline Sync: Download content for offline viewing on mobile devices
  • Subtitle Support: Multiple subtitle languages and formats

How to Access

Step 1: Create a Plex Account

  1. Visit plex.tv
  2. Click "Sign Up" and create a free account
  3. Remember your username - you'll need it for access requests

Step 2: Request Access

  1. Email plex@pez.solutions with your Plex username
  2. Include a brief introduction (optional but appreciated)
  3. Access is typically granted within 1 hour

Step 3: Connect to Server

  1. Open Plex on your device or visit plex.pez.sh
  2. Sign in with your Plex account
  3. The "Pez Solutions" server should appear in your server list
  4. Start streaming!

Supported Devices

  • Web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
  • Mobile apps (iOS, Android)
  • Smart TVs (Samsung, LG, Sony, etc.)
  • Streaming devices (Roku, Apple TV, Chromecast, Fire TV)
  • Gaming consoles (Xbox, PlayStation)
  • Desktop apps (Windows, macOS, Linux)

Content Library

Our Plex server includes:

  • Movies (latest releases and classics)
  • TV shows (current and past seasons)
  • Documentary content
  • Anime and international content

All content is legally sourced and complies with copyright regulations.

Request New Content

Want something specific? Use our content request system to submit requests for movies or TV shows. Most requests are processed within 24-48 hours.

Troubleshooting

Common Issues

  • Server not appearing: Check your internet connection and try refreshing the app
  • Buffering/playback issues: Reduce video quality in settings or check your internet speed
  • Access denied: Ensure you've been granted access and are using the correct account
  • Subtitle issues: Try switching subtitle tracks or disable/enable subtitles

Support

For issues specific to our Plex server, contact support@pez.solutions. For general Plex app issues, consult the official Plex support.
